result.execSummary:
The defendant Elijah M Lytle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward CL. Ban from CL's residence unless approved by agent. Ban from grounds and surrounding streets of East High School in Madison, WI. Not use/possess alcohol.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015 if def successfully completes probation including all financial obligations and no new referrals.

Comply with mental health treatment.   Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.   Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
7/12/22 CT orders condition of probation "Defendant must immediately seek mental health treatment at DC3 or Tellurian and comply with all treatment recommendations."

09:35 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Paul Fredrickson for Tracey J Lencioni.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

  Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #   
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, cc to 21CM1800, 21CM2234, 22CF1530

-No threats/acts of violence against: Christopher L
-Ban: Christopher L's residence unless approved by agent
-Ban: Grounds and surrounding streets of East High School in Madison, WI

Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)
Atty Tracey Lencioni

IN CUSTODY  02:36 PM Defendant Elijah M Lytle in court with attorney Tracey J Lencioni. Prosecuting Atty Rebekah M Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  State in agreement with Dr opinion.     Defendant in agreement with report. Atty Lencioni in agreement. CT finds DE incompetent, likely to be restored.  DE to be transported to appropriate facility for education and treatment to restore competence.    Further order that DE be transported by 3/21/22, if he is not transported by that time, Atty Lencioni to inform court, and court will hold another hearing.
Schoenecker, M.D.

03:47 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jon Oliver Helland.  Awais Khaleel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Defense raised competency.  COMPETENCY ORDERED.
